Bonus is given at second half of the year, while other banks in Singapore give bonus in Jan to March.

review_title: Good pay only for beginners and very limited career prospect
pros: 1. Very good pay for beginners with base salary about 50% higher than market standard 2. Small size in Poland and hence very easy to know everyone and all the processes related to banking 3. Good benefits with above-market medical insurance, vouchers (at least 10k PLN p.a.), and discretionary bonus twice a year 4. Good work life balance
cons: 1. Highly unstable corporate culture and working environment - dependent on the senior leadership which changes every few years 2. Zero career prospect as someone can just come from China with no experience and get a higher job title than you 3. High taxes paid monthly due to larger benefit package --> lower base net salary 4. Strong preference of hiring inexperienced Chinese fresh graduates to do important works instead of hiring local professionals 5. Lack of promotion and salary increase for good employees while regularly reimburses large unreasonable expenses of Chinese expats

job_title: Vice President Business Manager in Alhambra, CA
pros: Bank pays for benefits (HMO) for employee only, not family. Good 401k investment choices.
cons:
This bank can't get out of its own way. It is run similar to a dictatorship. Employees are forced to grovel and obey leadership, which is comprised of ex-pats from China on a 6 year rotation in and out of the US. These people do not understand US Banking culture and they don't care to learn. Although the bank hires experienced local people, no one's input or knowledge is valued acknowledged.
The Bank is not competitive in process, price, efficiency, speed or convenience and this makes it very difficult for a client to do business with the bank. Meanwhile, the Bank is unrelenting in their sales goals and demands for employees, which are rated on a quarterly basis, not annual. The Bank provides absolutely zero training in process and procedures, systems or any other area that would require training to enable success. In other words, this company sets a person up for failure and will act surprised when those results are actualized as a team and company.
This is not a good environment for any banker, retail, wholesale, commercial, servicing or credit. Morale is low, it is similar to a prison. Fellow prisoners are unwilling to help, after all, they are doing their own prison time, and only wanting to serve the Warden. Stay away from this draconian dump. You've been warned, my good citizens.

COVID19 cases are soaring and the bank decides to pull everyone back to office at mid-July when most other banks still let their employees to work from home. Most of our job functions require no in-person interaction and we have worked fine remotely for more than one year. Company also cut all our bonuses and raises during COVID even though our productivity did not dwindle during the pandemic

HR and senior managers refuse to make any accommodations and force all of us to make the long commute back to our super crammed-open-floor offices. This is not only unnecessary but oblivious to employees' health and preferences.

Work place cannot be healthy when managers lack the interest to improve employee's working conditions. Don't expect this company to look after your career or general well-being when all they care about is to "put the sheep back into their pens".

review_title: work in bank is not so well as it’s heard
pros: salary is not so bad
cons: boring and without  creativity work

pros:
A lot of training opportunities, including online lessons and short-term training camps. My team was in charge of some large projects, and that offers valuable experience. 
It is quite a surprise that many young talents are in charge of the core functions. For example, I was mainly in charge of credit analysis of those projects, and contacting engineers, financial managers, and CFOs. Promotion could be really fast for young graduates.
Also, you could feel the powerful but invisible government endorsement, and it makes soliciting clients easier for me. Honestly, I have absolutely no business or government contact when I get this position. It's mostly about your personality, your finance knowledge and English level. However, as a graduate, you must try your best to get such positions as mine. Most of the other graduates are doing retail banking, personal banking, or in charge of SMEs, which might be less fun.
cons:
The promotion process is less transparent. Some of the graduates could only wait for their destiny. 
Great starting point, but many would jump to other companies after several years, because of the salary.
Departments and titles are so different from international banks, and every time I introduce myself, I have to explain my position in detail! Why is everyone titled "Client manager"?

pros:
once you got a full time after probation, it seems you will never get yourself laid off.  
could learn something useful
colleagues are all nice and competent
It has a good platform as a RMB clearing hub 
conservative credit management perfectly mixed with front line marketing to control the overall risk.
cons:
very low pay
only legal stated vacations 
poor and inefficient HR, and i do not think HR has its full function
Top management can override anything. 
All top managers are dispatched directly from China, so it is impossible for local stuff get in to club.   
bad intensive and evaluation system for everyone.

review_title: Big comany, but reconsider to join as a college student
pros: Big company, a lot of chances, good salaries which was not affected in the ression, benefits were good too. Little OT is required.
cons: Great differences between branches. It was originally stated-owned, so it's operation mode is still like a government deparment although it's much larger.  Based on my observation, males got more opportunities. There were always a lot of meetings and activities held by the company out of the office time, and they alwyas "said" they were optional.

review_title: London Branch : Many resignations and poor top management decisions
pros:
I met a few excellent personalities there. Just a few. 

If you want to work 9-5 and if you don't have career expectations, you can go to London Branch.  They lost important knowhow, they need extra hands.

On the other hand the market is full of openings, with better perspectives and remuneration packages...
cons:
Half of the locally hired staff in London left massively and the other half has interviews, ready to leave. This says everything about all the wrong top management decisions. Unfortunately the hard work is not appreciated and the major problem is in the mentality.

Plasmatic promotions or no promotions and low salaries for the locally hired staff and they sell it as a favour, though you have done all the job. 

- No career perspective      - Low salaries      -No aprecciation

review_title: Great environment but work really varies by team
pros: A lot of the people you'll meet here are smart, friendly and respectful. Makes a nice difference for a banking environment. Senior management are generally approachable and happy to talk.
cons: The company has been cutting costs for a few years now so it's not always easy to pursue the more interesting work as there are always big regulatory deliverables. It's a small-ish company but there is sometimes too much big-bank bureaucracy.

pros: As a summer intern, I was responsible for cold call and do some business analysis. I encountered a lot of difficulties and learned a lot from the process. I cannot reach the right person on cold call at beginning and my call just be hung up by the reception desk. After several times failures to reach out, I learned about what is the right approach to contact a potential corporate client.
cons: The working environment was so relaxed and people are not very self-motivated. There are not many technical things to do in the Bank. Every day is the same.

pros:
Really organised and filled with events. The two weeks was filled with seminars, ntworking events and work shadowing. The work shadowing was a great experience and you get to see what all the teams within a certain division do.
Great career opportunities
You will work and learn from the smartest people on the street.
The pay is fair for the good performers.
cons: It was one of the most tiring two weeks in my life and I was very sleep deprived- but I think that was the point as they want us to know what the lifestyle is like.

review_title: I have been working at ICBC full-time (more than an year)
pros: They offer many opportunities for everyone to succeed - it's then down to the individual to make the most of them and shine. Work-life balance is encouraged, although with current initiatives to streamline processes, workload demands and expectations are high. Turn this into your advantage and take on these challenges and you will shines. Mobility within the organisation is well supported.
cons: Many challenges to be met in terms of the drive to become best in class. Salaries are not bad. Benefits package is part of your salary rather than in addition, but is widely accepted as being the most tax efficient.

pros: Fresh graduates need to go through two years rotation after hired to the head office of ICBC. The rotation is quite tough. You have to work as a teller for one year. Then you will spend the second year in a particular division at a branch. Although the training is tough, it is good for a new employee to know how things operate at the basic level of a commercial bank's business.
cons: Too many students are hired every year. The selecting process is like picking the stereotype that fit for the bank. Another point to mention is the hierarchy and bureaucracy which are quite typical in state-owned banks.

pros: The bank provides good induction training and decent employee benefits, and its internal recruitment opportunity is fair. The bank also has a good business culture. It cares about employee' lives and encourages employees to study further.
cons: The bank cares a lot about the basis level working experience. That's why most of its employees start their career from teller and the promotion is slow compared with other banks. It also values seniority more than ability; too many staff in 40's and 50's , which bring less opportunity to young people.

job_title: Manager, Back Office in Hong Kong
pros: Not much overtime work, colleagues are friendly, long lunch hours in practice.
cons: Poor benefit and compensation package comparing with the market; top management is short sighted; issues of integrity and compliance as mainland Chinese culture usually neglect all these; unfair treatment to local employees as expatriates from mainland China offices usually enjoy good benefits, promotion opportunities and more attention; normally mainland Chinese take up the management positions but they come and go every 3 to 5 years which affecting the work morale.

review_title: Shockingly incompetent and unprofessional environment. Think twice before joining. Place is a joke.
job_title: Commercial Banking in New York, NY
pros:
Easy hours and minimal challenge as bank has few products.
Hiring process is very simple since they are a generally unappealing employer outside of China.
cons:
Management is incompetent and clueless on local market practices, all appointed despite little to no experience.
Compensation is a joke, promotion opportunities nonexistent, rampant nepotism, virtually zero career development.
Majority of staff has poor English skills and prefers to speak Chinese which does nothing to improve their situation. Many internal communications are only in Chinese to the detriment of non-Chinese speakers.

pros: The working environment was really good. Nice working atmosphere and nice relationship within people

review_title: Traditional bank with some good exposure

cons: System/IT support is not sufficient and also the method of doing things may not be that modern.  Sometimes it would also be quite bureautic and self-interest of a department is often seen to be placed above the overall well-being of the Bank without reasoning.

pros: Good working environment and high salary. Do not need to travel a lot. There are many good opportunities in the bank since it is the largest bank in China.
